taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [from Latin saponis , soap, and - aria , pertaining to, alluding to sap]

bio:treatment.discussion: Saponaria pumilio (Linnaeus) Fenzl ex A. Braun [= Silene pumilio (Linnaeus) Wulfen], a species of the Alps and the Carpathians, was collected once from a ledge on Mount Washington, New Hampshire, in 1964; the collector, S. K. Harris (1965), suggested that it may have been an intentional planting. A cespitose plant, it differs from the two species below also in its one-flowered, rather than several-flowered, stems.

references.reference: Shults, V. A. 1989. Rod Myl’nyanka (Saponaria L. s.l.) vo Flore SSSR. Riga.
